channel.title: USPTO All Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO All events.

item.title: Learn about pro bono programs available at the USPTO
item.description: Do you want to learn more about pro bono programs available at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO)? Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, June 9, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a discussion about the various pro bono efforts at the USPTO and the pro bono volunteer opportunities available to practitioners.

item.title: Patent Public Search: Tips for frequent searchers
item.description: Want to learn more about how the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) new Patent Public Search tool can improve your patent searching?

item.title: Texas listening session with Director Kathi Vidal
Fundamentos básicos de las patentes
item.description: Si tiene una invención o una idea para un posible producto, no se pierda esta oportunidad. Exploraremos las diferentes clases o tipos de patentes, incluyendo patentes de utilidad, patentes de diseño, y patentes de plantas. Adicionalmente, explicaremos la diferencia y el uso de solicitudes (aplicaciones) de patentes provisionales y no-provisionales.

item.title: Patent basics
item.description: Are you interested in learning about the basics of intellectual property (IP) and patents?

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during one of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: PPAC fireside chat with Director Kathi Vidal
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) at the next public PPAC meeting to hear newly-confirmed Director Kathi Vidal answer USPTO stakeholder questions. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO on patent-related policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees.

item.title: The Hand of History-The Mind of the Inventor Session 2: Television
item.description: Join us for a month-long journey into the history of innovation by registering for the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) webinar series, The Hand of History—The Mind of the Inventor. The series will focus on 20th century inventions, led by a group of historians with great stories to tell about specific inventors, their patents, and the crucial role of invention in economic progress from the 1900s to the 1950s.

item.title: The Hand of History-The Mind of the Inventor Session 2: Television
item.description: Join us for a month-long journey into the history of innovation by registering for the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) webinar series, The Hand of History—The Mind of the Inventor. The series will focus on 20th century inventions, led by a group of historians with great stories to tell about specific inventors, their patents, and the crucial role of invention in economic progress from the 1900s to the 1950s.

item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during one of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: PPAC fireside chat with Director Kathi Vidal
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) at the next public PPAC meeting to hear newly-confirmed Director Kathi Vidal answer USPTO stakeholder questions. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO on patent-related policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part one: From ideas to innovations
item.description: Do you have an idea you want to bring to life? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to get inspired by successful innovators turning concepts into creations. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part one: From ideas to innovations.

item.title: Patent Quality Chat: Sequence listings under ST.26 and new USPTO rules
item.description: Learn about World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) Standard ST.26 and upcoming changes to sequence listings filed in patent applications that contain disclosures of nucleotide and/or amino acid sequences. Standard ST.26, requiring XML formatting, will go into effect worldwide on July 1, 2022, and the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) is adopting new rules (37 CFR 1.831-1.835 and 1.839) to implement this standard.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part one: From ideas to innovations
item.description: Do you have an idea you want to bring to life? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to get inspired by successful innovators turning concepts into creations. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part one: From ideas to innovations.

item.title: Conducting an effective patent examiner interview
item.description: Are you a patent practitioner looking for tips on conducting a successful examiner interview?

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
item.description: Are you an inventor? Join us for this session full of important tips on filing a patent application and what to do after you file for a patent. Learn about common mistakes to avoid and gain a better understanding of post-filing procedures and support. Register now for this free virtual event.

item.title: Fundamentos básicos de las marcas registradas
item.description: Esta sesión es imprescindible para cualquier emprendedor o negocio pequeño interesado en obtener una marca registrada. Exploraremos los tipos diferentes de marcas registradas, incluyendo nombres de las marcas, diseños, logotipos, e imágenes comerciales.

The series will focus on 20th century inventions, led by a group of historians with great stories to tell about specific inventors, their patents, and the crucial role of invention in economic progress from the 1900s to the 1950s.

item.description: Are you passionate about taking your special idea to the market? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to learn how to commercialize your innovation. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Professional responsibility and practice before the USPTO
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Office of Enrollment and Discipline (OED) for a discussion with Attorney Dahlia George about professional responsibility and expectations for registered patent agents and attorneys.

item.title: Learn how to protect your technology abroad
item.description: Did you know that you can seek patent protection in another country?

item.title: Learn how examiners approach 35 U.S.C. § 103 examining evidence
item.description: Would you like to learn more about examination practices and procedural guidance for 35 U.S.C. § 103 examining evidence? Register today for part three of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) virtual Instructor-Led Training (vILT) series on June 28. The course has limited capacity, and selection for attendance is based on a first-come, first-served basis.

item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 1: Fundamentals
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this first module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on trademark protection in the United States. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 2: Registration process overview
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this second module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on the overall trademark registration process, from filing to registration. Understanding the process is critical to avoid missing any filing deadlines, which could jeopardize your application or registration. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Patent Trial and Appeal Board presents Appeals 101
item.description: Interested in learning more about the appeal process? Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) for a presentation on July 13, 2022.

item.title: Patent Trial and Appeal Board presents Appeals 101
item.description: Interested in learning more about the appeal process? Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) for a presentation on July 13, 2022.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Truth over trust
item.description: The utilization of non-fungible tokens (NFTs), geofencing, and biometrics are being investigated to create a future that relies on truth over trust. Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a discussion about this developing technology that will revolutionize the way people conduct transactions.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 3: Searching
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this third module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on important principles related to trademark searching and effective use of the USPTO's Trademark Electronic Search System (TESS). The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 4: Application requirements
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this fourth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on the requirements for an initial trademark application. Knowing what is needed up front will help your filing process go more smoothly. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: K-12 IP education office hours
K-12 IP education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 5: Application filing walk-through
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this fifth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on the USPTO's Trademark Electronic Application System (TEAS), including a live demonstration of a trademark filing. TEAS is the required system for making any trademark submission to the USPTO. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 6: Responding to an office action
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this sixth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on responding to office actions, the official letters that USPTO examining attorneys issue after reviewing your trademark application. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Invention-Con 2022: Inspiring and redefining the innovative mindset
Invention-Con 2022: Inspiring and redefining the innovative mindset
Invention-Con 2022: Inspiring and redefining the innovative mindset
Invention-Con 2022: Inspiring and redefining the innovative mindset
Invention-Con 2022: Inspiring and redefining the innovative mindset
Invention-Con 2022: Inspiring and redefining the innovative mindset
Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 7: Keeping your registration alive
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this seventh module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll focus on what happens after registration, including mandatory filings to keep your registration alive. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Cross section of blockchain, patents, and open source
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and East Coast Attorney James Gatto to investigate the intersection of blockchain, patents, and open source and the interesting legal issues they present.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 8: Question-and-answer panel
item.description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this final module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we'll provide a unique opportunity for you to 'meet the trademark experts.' Come prepared with all of your trademark questions to share with our Law Office Managing Attorneys and other trademark experts. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.

item.title: Propiedad intelectual 101
item.description: ¿Desea familiarizarse con las patentes, las marcas registradas, los derechos de autor, y los secretos comerciales? De ser así, le invitamos para que aprenda acerca de los fundamentos básicos de la propiedad intelectual (PI) y las formas potenciales de proteger sus innovaciones durante su transición de una idea al producto.

item.title: Intellectual property 101
item.description: Do you want to know more about patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Join us for a free, virtual session to learn about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovations as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Resources for inventors, innovators, and entrepreneurs
item.description: Are you new to the world of patents and trademarks and need some help?

item.title: Recursos útiles para inventores y emprendedores
item.description: Si desea aprender más acerca de cómo proteger su propiedad intelectual, no deje pasar la oportunidad de participar en esta sesión informativa.

item.title: International agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course - RESCHEDULED
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent residing internationally (i.e. outside of the United States), you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from September 13-16, 2022.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: USC 101 patent eligibility in blockchain
item.description: Claims define the boundaries of intellectual property just as property lines define the boundaries of a house. Over the past few years, USC 101 has been clarified regarding patent eligibility as inventions in the digital space because they do not always produce tangible end results.

item.title: Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Stakeholder spotlight
item.description: Hear about the innovations and inventions in supply chain management, credit cards, insurance, and banking that companies along the United States Eastern seaboard are pursuing. These real-world use cases will delight and inspire your outlook of the future.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.
